isis.stitle: RADIATOR, REMOVE AND REPLACE - MXT - RADIATOR and Component INSTALLation - SURGE TANK

svcproc.title: SURGE TANK
svcproc.para: Check the condition of surge tank for leaks or damage before installing.

step1.para: Locate surge tank on radiator surge tank mounting bracket and install upper mounting bolts (Figure 29).

figure.caption: Figure 29. Surge Tank Showing Top of Mounting Bracket with All Hoses Attached

step1.para: Align side-mounting holes in surge tank with holes in surge tank mounting bracket and install bolts (Figure 30).
Re-attach the bottom hose to the engine thermostat housing using a worm-style clamp (if previously removed).
Re-attach the upper radiator surge hose to the radiator using a compression clamp.
Re-attach the overflow surge hose to the overflow tank using a compression clamp.
Re-attach the upper engine fitting surge hose (if it was removed) using a worm-style clamp.
Close the petcock in lower radiator.
Replace coolant after all other installations have been completed.
Place the front crossmember assembly between the frame rails at the front of the chassis.
Insert the four mounting bolts and tighten.

svcproc.para: When all installations, surge tank and related components, including charge air cooler pipes and clamps and front crossmember are installed, start engine and check for leaks. If leaks appear, recheck connecting tubes and all clamps for proper installation.

figure.caption: Figure 30. Properly Installed Surge Tank (Located on Driver Side)
